text.content:
### Charts
#### Application Load Balancer Metrics

* Tracks the request and latency of external and internal application load balancers.
* Please refer to the [public page](https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/metrics) for complete list of Application Load Balancer metrics.

#### Inferece Gateway Metrics
* Tracks the performance of inference model and inference pool. 
* Please refer to the [official documentation](https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/gateway-api-inference-extension/blob/main/site-src/guides/metrics.md) for more details of underlying metrics used in the dashboard.

#### Model Server Metrics
* Tracks the performance of model servers, including token throughput, request latency, time per output token latency and time to first token latency. 
* Charts are only populated if the model server is exporting metrics.
* You can navigate to the detail dashboard for model servers under the integration tab (e.g. [vLLM](https://console.cloud.google.com/monitoring/dashboards/integration/vllm.vllm-prometheus)). 

### How to use:

#### Inference Pool has high queue length and kv-cache utilization

* **Filter**: Use the filter dropdowns above to drill down to a single cluster / location / namespace / Load Balancer.
* **Identify issues**: Review the *Inference Pool* section for overview of high-level metrics like queue length and kv-cache utilization.
* **Investigate**: Review *Request / s* charts.
* **Analyze**: Examine the chart to see if the issue is caused by increasing number of requests and cause saturation of resources.
* **Decision**: Follow the [Configure autoscaling](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/customize-gke-inference-gateway-configurations#autoscaling) to autoscales your workloads.

widget.title: Inference Pool Average KV Cache Utilization

Tracks the performance of inference model and inference pool.

timeSeriesQuery.prometheusQuery: sum by (error_code, model_name, target_model_name) (rate(inference_model_request_error_total[${__interval}])) or on() vector(0)
